title.zh: 人腦的「Google 地圖」：科學家首次繪製完整人類大腦細胞圖譜
title.en: Google Maps for the Brain: Scientists Chart the First Complete Human Brain Cell Atlas

summary.zh:
想像一下，如果有一天你能像瀏覽 Google 地圖那樣，逐個細胞地探索人類大腦——這正是 BRAIN Initiative Cell Atlas Network（BICAN）聯盟的終極目標。在本期《Science》封面文章中，來自全球數十家機構的研究者聯手發布了迄今最完整的人腦細胞類型目錄。

研究者利用單細胞 RNA 定序技術，對超過 300 萬個腦細胞進行了系統分析，識別出了超過 3,000 種不同的細胞亞型。這份圖譜不僅揭示了人腦中驚人的細胞多樣性，還發現了與思覺失調症、雙相情緒障礙症、阿茲海默症等神經精神疾病風險基因高度相關的特定細胞群體——為理解和治療這些疾病提供了全新的標靶線索。
summary.en:
Imagine browsing the human brain the way you browse Google Maps — zooming from hemisphere to lobe to individual cell. That ambition drives the BRAIN Initiative Cell Atlas Network (BICAN), and in this issue of Science, a global consortium takes a giant step toward making it real.

Using single-cell RNA sequencing on more than three million brain cells, the team has assembled the most complete catalog of human brain cell types to date, identifying over 3,000 distinct subtypes. The atlas doesn't merely showcase the brain's staggering cellular diversity; it also pinpoints specific cell populations that are tightly linked to risk genes for schizophrenia, bipolar disorder, and Alzheimer's disease — offering fresh targets for understanding and eventually treating these conditions.

keyArticle.title: A complete cell-type atlas of the human brain

caption.zh: 人腦細胞圖譜的三維視覺化——不同顏色代表不同的細胞亞型，共超過 3,000 種。
caption.en: Three-dimensional visualization of the human brain cell atlas — different colors represent distinct cell subtypes, totaling over 3,000.
